Author: okthen#8167
Content: Hi! How can I generate a new  receive address from within Agama V0.2.41-Beta?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: are you using Native mode or SPV/Lite mode

Author: okthen#8167
Content: Lite

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: when you start Agama wallet, select Lite mode for KMD or any other chain, you will be taken to login screen. there you can create a new passphrase which will generate a new address.

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: save the seed passphrase before you do anyting in a notepad

Author: okthen#8167
Content: ok thanks

Author: okthen#8167
Content: impossible to generate a new address in the same wallet?

Author: crumb#2550
Content: in lite (spv) mode only one address per seed

Author: okthen#8167
Content: ok clear

Author: RyanInSiam#8426
Content: Morning, Komodo team!

Author: RyanInSiam#8426
Content: Have traded Komodo off and on based on a tip from a friend but am now looking to invest long-term. 😃

Author: RyanInSiam#8426
Content: Figured I better do a more thorough read-up on KMD and also join everyone here.

Author: RyanInSiam#8426
Content: Anyone around?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Bad time of day here, what were you looking for exactly?

Author: RyanInSiam#8426
Content: First interest is in the "rewards" system. I hadn't realized earlier that KMD offers rewards like staking coins. Tried to read up on this on your site, but it's a bit confusing.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Easily explained. You just need to make a transcation once a month and you get 5% (calculated over one year, not 5% each month)

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: You dont need to stake, or mine to get this. Most of the generated KMD comes from 5% APR.

Author: RyanInSiam#8426
Content: So, by sending KMD or receiving KMD, I'll get rewards sometime throughout the year?

Author: RyanInSiam#8426
Content: And this is based solely on having tokens in my wallet? I don't need to leave the wallet live like PoS coins?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: No, there is an extra rule in the mining consensus that lets you spend more vouts, than you have vins based on a calculation of time.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: the coins just "appear" when you make a transaction

Author: RyanInSiam#8426
Content: So, again, it can be either sending or receiving?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Sending only.... It will start to accrue when it is received and stop accruing 1 month after it was received, and it will claim when it is sent.

Author: RyanInSiam#8426
Content: Ah, so I always have to send out. Got it.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: You don't have to... it will just start to accrue again after you send it... Otherwise it will stop after one month.

Author: RyanInSiam#8426
Content: Right.

Author: RyanInSiam#8426
Content: Any good articles or primers on this topic?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: not 100% sure on articles. I think if there is anything it will be in the FAQ of the website.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: The 1 month was only recently changed from 1 year. It actrually activates at block 1 million, which is about 1 month away.

Author: RyanInSiam#8426
Content: Yeah, I already read the FAQ, which is what lead me here. 😛

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: ha yeah, there has been a lot of effort in creating new content to summarise things but there is still a lot. KMD is very large and complex, took me months to figure it all out.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: bottom line is... make transactions get free coins.

Author: RyanInSiam#8426
Content: Got it.

Author: RyanInSiam#8426
Content: Thanks for taking the time, @blackjok3r! 😃

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: no worries

Author: AkiraX#8269
Content: @blackjok3r how are you?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yeah pretty good

Author: AkiraX#8269
Content: Still holding hush

Author: AkiraX#8269
Content: It's rough

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: haha, holding nothing really.

Author: Acura#2748
Content: @RyanInSiam https://komodoplatform.atlassian.net/wiki/plugins/servlet/mobile?contentId=71729215#content/view/71729215

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: @RyanInSiam you can also just use the agama wallet which has an easy claim intrest button which basically just sends your entire balance to yourself to have the accrued rewards added to your balance

Author: RyanInSiam#8426
Content: Perfect, @Cryptoon ! That's the wallet I just downloaded.

Author: RyanInSiam#8426
Content: Out of curiosity, can we also get rewards from using Coinomi?

Author: RyanInSiam#8426
Content: (If so, I fully understand I'd have to manually send out the coins and then get them back again.)

Author: RyanInSiam#8426
Content: Ah, nevermind. This is covered in @Acura 's link.

Author: haha#6652
Content: When will latency be fixed with kmd blockchains? I can't really have transactions taking anymore than a couple seconds

Author: haha#6652
Content: will chains be lightning network compatible?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it goes in the mempool pretty instantly, why cant you wait for confirmations?

Author: haha#6652
Content: because i can't have people waiting long. payments should basically be instant

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it appears in the explorer within seconds. so why are people waiting long?

Author: haha#6652
Content: for confirmations

Author: haha#6652
Content: and finality

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so you are saying lightning network is needed, but also confirmations are needed?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you do realize lightning network transactions dont get confirmed until the channel is closed

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if LN payments are ok, then so should tx in a mempool that isnt confirmed yet, as those also show on the explorer. Then again I am using logic and not having some attempt to troll

Author: xRobeSx#5136
Content: KMD also has 1 minute blocks. TX's tend to confirm pretty damn fast

Author: haha#6652
Content: Yes but LN transactions are very,very trustable. Any disagreements go onchain

Author: haha#6652
Content: waiting 1 minute is something that I can't do

Author: CHMEX#0686
Content: Maybe you want to create your own assetchain with on demand blocks notarizing to KMD that might be more instant for you

Author: xRobeSx#5136
Content: CHIPS has LN and 10 second block times

Author: haha#6652
Content: Thanks xrobe

Author: xRobeSx#5136
Content: but chmex's idea of an assetchain is good too. All blocks are on demand

Author: haha#6652
Content: Last question, why use dpow?

Author: xRobeSx#5136
Content:
dPoW allows you to have bitcoin level security on KMD or your own assetchain. 

TX's are notarized onto Bitcoin Blockchain so its protected by the btc's hashrate

Author: haha#6652
Content: Thanks

Author: xRobeSx#5136
Content: The bonus with dPoW, is that you can still use PoW, PoS, or both PoW/PoS as well

Author: haha#6652
Content: Also do you think sub second block times will ever be possible with dPoW

Author: xRobeSx#5136
Content: I'm not sure you'll get sub second block times with an assetchain.

Author: xRobeSx#5136
Content: dPoW it self only records every set amount of blocks.  So your assetchain would notarize to KMD every say 10 blocks.

Author: xRobeSx#5136
Content: and KMD notarizes to BTC every X blocks. Not every block is notarized

Author: haha#6652
Content: ty

Author: mirel | mindtame.net#7931
Content: is there an official tx/s number out there that has been reached?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: 20,000 TX/s of sendmany 100 (which was 800,000 payments per second)

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: using 1024 chains.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: using a 64 chain cluster where all chains cna send coins to each other, we acheived ~7000 TX/s

Author: mirel | mindtame.net#7931
Content: thank you.... would you point me to a link of some sort... I want to distribute this information

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: sure I have a few.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: #dev-scalability

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: go to pinned

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: http://cryptocartography.io/txscl_vis/

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: That is the site we are working on now, it has links to all the old tests.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: The data it loads by default is simulated data, not confirmed. It was to stress test the stats gathering software.

ca333#0118
Content: those articles contain some background infos and details

Content: thank you. I'm not a developer ... But I keep hearing good stuff about Komodo and I'm really thinking of investing in this. So I am now on research mode and I'm trying to spark conversations with different groups on themes like scalability, security, anonimity... etc.... and see what people have to say.
